column4: I'm having trouble installing/getting my fluxbox to work.. i've configured the .xinitrc file to exec fluxbox.. but when i try type startx nothing happens, but x starts when i type Xorg (with no fluxbox) and when i try typing "startfluxbox" it won't start because there's no XServer to connect to
anyone that can help me out?
try execing fluxbox from $HOME/.xsessionrc
it doesnt work, still complains about that there's no XServer to connect to
did you run startx after changing .xsessionrc ?
startx doesnt work, but Xorg starts X
what do you mean by "doesn't work"?
you need the xinit package then.
if you're a newbie, why do you want fluxbox?
i want to learn.. advance a bit
how did you install?
install what?
Ubuntu (I'm assuming that's what you installed)
by CD
do you have an old or slow machine?
no it's a pretty new one
I suggest you run 'apt-get install ubuntu-desktop' as root, then.
that'll give you a workable environment without too much fiddling around.
in that case I suggest you install 'xubuntu-desktop'. It's a lot slimmer.
small and easy?
well, the gnome desktop (which you get with the ubuntu-desktop package) is the easiest.
you can always uninstall packages later when you've gathered some experience
fluxbuntu isn't an official ubuntu project (yet), so it won't have the same level of support as ubuntu, xubuntu or kubuntu.
